snippet: The price tag for the single work was a far cry from the roughly $4,700 in today’s dollars that Modigliani sought for the entire contents of his Paris studio in 1918-19.
abstract: Amedeo Modigliani painting Nu Couche sells at Christie's for $170.4 million, second-highest price paid for work of art at auction and becoming 10th work of art to bring nine figures.

byline.original: By ROBIN POGREBIN and SCOTT REYBURN
byline.contributor: Amy Qin contributed reporting from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: The price tag for the single work was a far cry from the roughly $4,700 in today’s dollars that Modigliani sought for the entire contents of his Paris studio in 1918-19.

headline.main: With $170.4 Million Sale at Auction, Modigliani Work Joins Rarefied Nine-Figure Club
headline.print_headline: Modigliani Work Sells for $170.4 Million, Joining a Rare Club
